Title.evidence: This randomised controlled trial aimed to examine the impact of timing of first massive transfusion (MT) cooler delivery on patient outcomes.

Trial_Design.evidence: patients predicted to receive MT were randomised to two transfusion ratios (1:1:1 vs. 1:1:2) as per the PROPPR trial.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at 12 level-1 trauma centers, patients predicted to receive MT were randomised.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to two transfusion ratios (1:1:1 vs. 1:1:2)

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial aimed to examine the impact of timing of first massive transfusion (MT) cooler delivery on patient outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was mortality, measured at 24 hours and 30 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a centralised system, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 680 patients were randomised.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Delays in MT activation and cooler delivery were associated with prolonged time to hemostasis (coef 1.09, p=0.001 and coef 1.16, p<0.001) and increased mortality (OR 1.02, p=0.009 and OR 1.02, p=0.012).
